page.title: 03The Village Church
page.content: {St. Giles Church}is a lovely place. The oldest part, the nave, dates from {Norman}times about 1180 and work continued until the 13th century. The church has two side chapels, a chancel and a nave .The south Chapel is known as the{Mitton Chapel}.It was added to the church about 1230 and was named after{Sir Nicholas De Mittune.}In this chapel is the splendid tomb of{Sir {Giles Reed}with his wife and children. This monument is one of the finest in the country. The north chapel was added to the nave about the same time as the spire was added to the tower between 1300& 1339.The{font}originally stood in the nave between the north and south doors. It dates from the 15th century. The chancel is noted for its original{fourteenth century {windows}and the large number of{tiles dating from the same period.
